definition: USFS Lab Chemistry (April 15, 2013  began running cations and anions analysis)
Cary Lab Chemistry (April 1, 2013 ended all analysis)
High flow streamwater sample; taken during specific event, not usually a routine weekly sample.
Low flow streamwater sample; taken with a syringe or cup from a standing pool of water, usually during a drought period.

Extremely low volume precipitation sample; applies to samples when volume is insufficient to conduct all analyses. -3 or -999.9 will be entered into the files as code for QNS (quantity not sufficient)
multiple samples on same day (W1 & W6 2001-2003)
multiple samples on same day (W1 & W6 2001-2003)
Possible analytical problem based on return lab data; flagged for further scrutiny and possible rejection. In most cases, suspect data are rejected (see code 970).

Sample contaminated; possible rejection based on further analytical data. This a flag code for future screening of the data. Protocol requires rejection of heavily tainted samples, but in many cases the degree of contamination is uncertain. NOTE if a code of 970 is retained in the database chemistry file, the flux program will ignore those data. All codes for 970â€™s must be re-checked.
Sample was used in the estimation of previously reported monthly and annual volume-weighted concentrations and in calculating watershed fluxes
Sample was not used in the estimation of previously reported monthly and annual volume-weighted concentrations and in calculating watershed fluxes
